question: Question #388: A business analyst (BA) is working on a payment system (PS) implementation. A set of systems which should interact with a new payment system has been identified. The business analyst defined that a user with role of 'Supervisor' in the PS must pass a two-factor authentication before an execution of the functions: 'Change system parameters' and 'Set up new supervisor.' A user must have the role of 'Supervisor' to use the standard functions 'Send mail notification' or 'Send SMS notification'. The BA wants to create a Use Case diagram. Which standard relationship should be defined between 'Setup new supervisor' and 'Send notification'?
options: A. Setup new supervisor <<Include>> Send notification
B. Setup new supervisor <<Include>> Send notification (Alternative representation)
C. Setup new supervisor <<Extend>> Send notification
D. Setup new supervisor <<Extend>> Send notification (Alternative representation)
explanation: The <<Extend>> relationship is used when a use case conditionally adds behavior to another use case. Since sending notifications is optional behavior that can extend the setup new supervisor functionality, the <<Extend>> relationship is appropriate.

question: Question #389: A business analyst (BA) is working on a payment system (PS) implementation. A set of systems which should interact with a new system has been identified. The business analyst defined that a user with role of 'Supervisor' in the PS must pass a two-factor authentication before an execution of the functions: 'Change system parameters' and 'Set up new supervisor.' A user must have the role of 'Supervisor' to use the standard functions 'Send mail notification' or 'Send SMS notification'. The BA defined the following use cases: 'Change system parameters', 'Setup new supervisor', 'Send mail notification', 'Send SMS notification', 'Send notification', 'Pass a two-factor authentication'. The BA wants to create a Use Case diagram. What standard relationship should be defined between 'Change system parameters', 'Setup new supervisor' and 'Pass a two-factor authentication'?
options: A. Both Change system parameters and Setup new supervisor connect directly to Pass a two-factor authentication
B. Both use cases use <<Extend>> relationship to Pass a two-factor authentication
C. Both use cases use <<Protect>> relationship to Pass a two-factor authentication
D. Both use cases use <<Include>> relationship to Pass a two-factor authentication
explanation: Since both 'Change system parameters' and 'Setup new supervisor' require two-factor authentication as a prerequisite, they should have a direct dependency relationship to 'Pass a two-factor authentication'. This represents that authentication must be completed before these functions can be executed.
